greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 1/(1 + 2*x - x^2).
comment: The sequence 0, 1, -2, 5, -12, 29, -70, 169, -408, 985, ... with a leading 0 is the Lucas U(-2,-1)-sequence. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 08 2013
a(n) is the irrational part of the Q(sqrt(2)) integer (sqrt(2) - 1)^n = A123335(n) + a(n-1)*sqrt(2), with a(-1) = 0. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Dec 07 2014
irrational part of the Q(sqrt(2)) integer giving the length of a variant of Lévy's C-curve at iteration step n. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Dec 07 2014
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
M. Janjic, Hessenberg Matrices and Integer Sequences , J. Int. Seq. 13 (2010) # 10.7.8.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-2,1)
formula: a(0)=1, a(1)=-2, a(n) = -2*a(n-1) + a(n-2) for n>1. - _Philippe Deléham_, Sep 19 2009
G.f.: 1/(2+Q(0)), where Q(k)= 3*x - 1 + x*k + x*(1-x)*(k+1)/Q(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 05 2013
G.f.: Q(0)/(2+2*x), where Q(k)= 1 + 1/(1 - x*(2*k-1)/( x*(2*k+1) + 1/Q(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 10 2013
G.f.: Q(0)/2, where Q(k) = 1 + 1/(1 - x*(4*k+2 - x )/( x*(4*k+4 - x) - 1/Q(k+1) )); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 09 2013
a(n) = (-1)^n * a(-2-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 20 2017
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[1/(1 + 2 x/(1 + x/(2 - x))), {x, 0, 30}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 21 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<-1, (-1)^n*a(-2-n), polcoeff( 1 / (1 + 2*x - x^2) + x * O(x^n), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 20 2017 */
(MAGMA) I:=[1,-2]; [n le 2 select I[n] else -2*Self(n-1)+Self(n-2): n in [1..35]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 21 2017
xref: Essentially the same as A000129, which is the main entry for these numbers.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 17 2002
